title: Bell Pottinger's former boss locked in dispute over demand for £400,000
text:
The former head of failed public relations firm Bell Pottinger is wrangling with the firm’s administrators over a demand that he repay £400,000 he allegedly received before the outfit went bust.

James Henderson - chief executive of Bell Pottinger until he resigned in just days before administrators were called in - is disputing demands to cough up the cash, a source said.

Bell Pottinger fell into administration in September 2017 amid a storm of criticism over a campaign it ran for a company owned by the wealthy Gupta family in South Africa that was alleged to have stirred up racial tensions.
